text:
It's really funny you mention about idle poses and cycles, because I've spoken to my tutors about having cycles in an animation showreels, it's frowned upon. But I never really believed that to be honest, seeing as a lot of games focus on cycles for their characters/assets (walk cycles and run cycles etcetera.)

So what projects are you working on at the moment? And are you enjoying your work? :)

It is dependent on where you are applying really. I was always film focused, and was specifically asked whether I had cycles. I wouldn’t specifically put idles on my reel, but you can learn a lot from them. There is also no harm in contacting the companies you want to work for and asking what type of work they would like to see.
I have several different reels for different types of work that I do. Different reels for different types of animation (creature, character, previs), layout, vfx and for filmmaking in general
It’s very time consuming to manage them, but I try to update them as I get copies of my work so that I’m not bogged down. I just incorporate it into my overall workflow.

Unfortunately I can’t tell you what I’m working on. Sorry ;) However, I can say that I’ve just finished a very big show, and have moved onto a smaller show while I wait for something else to land. I’ve almost worked on all the different franchises now, and the thing I enjoy the most is working with good people and feeling like you are helping to make the film. Sometimes the biggest shows are the least rewarding. So in the future, I’m going to be looking for smaller, more interesting films.
I was lucky enough to travel to Belfast to work on Game of Thrones last year, and I’m very excited a out that coming out. They were great people to work with
